Program name: Doctor of Education in Educational Leadership

Requirements: The Ph.D. program in Clinical Psychology begins in the fall semester of each year. To be considered for admission, all application materials must be received on or before December 1. Applicants must have an undergraduate degree in psychology or 24 credit hours of psychology coursework, including courses in statistics and research methods from an accredited university. The required application materials include: Online Application for Admission to UHCL Graduate School, Application Fee, Official Transcripts from all schools attended, Official Graduate Record Examination (GRE) General Test Scores, Three Letters of Recommendation, Curriculum Vitae (CV)/Resume, Statement of Purpose, Writing Sample. Please note: For the 2024-2025 application cycle, the GRE will be optional.
Program name: Doctor of Philosophy in Clinical Psychology

Requirements: To apply, you must submit a graduate application online through Apply Texas and pay the non-refundable application fee. Official transcripts from all institutions attended are required, along with a Master's Degree from an accredited university; a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 hours of coursework is preferred. Applicants must also provide a professional resume/vita, three letters of recommendation, a 300-500 word statement of career goals and purpose, and a scholarly writing sample that demonstrates research and writing ability (e.g., Master's thesis, peer-reviewed article, book chapter). A valid Texas teaching certificate and three years of successful, full-time teaching experience in an accredited PK-12 school are also required. Finally, an interview with the Doctoral Admissions Committee is required for all admission candidates. International applicants may need to provide official TOEFL scores.
Program name: Doctor of Education in Curriculum and Instruction with a focus on science, technology, engineering, and mathematics

Requirements:
When you apply, you'll need to submit the following:

Graduate Application: Submit the online application for graduate students through Apply Texas.
Application Fee: Pay the non-refundable fee.
Transcripts: Submit official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
GRE Requirements: No GRE is required.
Program name: Master of Arts in Curriculum and Instruction

Requirements: GPA Requirements: Applicants must have a minimum 2.500 cumulative GPA on the last 60 hours of coursework. Applicants who do not meet the minimum GPA requirement may be considered for conditional admission.
Program name: Master of Arts in Educational Leadership and Administration

Requirements:
To apply for the Instructional Design and Technology M.S., you will need to submit an application for admission and the following required documents:

*   Transcripts: Official transcripts from every college or university attended, including community college.
*   GPA: A cumulative GPA of at least 2.5 is required for admission consideration.
*   Required Documents: A personal statement (250-500 words), and a resume.
*   GRE Scores: Not required.
Program name: Master of Arts in Educational/Instructional Technology

Program name: Master of Arts in Early Childhood Education and Teaching

Requirements: University of Houston-Clear Lake's College of Business is proud to have a diverse student body. We welcome all applicants with a 4-year bachelor's degree (or foreign equivalent) from an accredited university to apply. New Student Admission for the MBA Program is a competitive process. To be considered for admission, all candidates are evaluated based on the following criteria: 1. Undergraduate GPA, 2. GMAT/GRE Score*, 3. Professional Experience, 4. Other Considerations (e.g. advanced degrees, professional certifications). *The GMAT/GRE requirement is currently waived through Fall 2026. The College of Business reserves the right to request a GMAT/GRE score from any applicant.
Program name: Master of Business Administration

Requirements: Applicants to the M.S. in Accounting program must meet the general graduate admission requirements of the College of Business as well as the specific requirements for the M.S. in Accounting. College of Business general graduate admission requirements include a minimum GMAT score of 450 with a minimum of 10% on the verbal and quantitative sections of the exam, and a GPA of 2.5. Students that do not meet these criteria may be considered for conditional admission. A GMAT waiver may be considered for M.S. in Accounting applicants who have: an advanced degree (e.g., master's, doctoral, professional degree such as law or medicine) from a U.S. regionally-accredited institution; a GPA of 3.0 or greater from a U.S. regionally-accredited institution, including 12 hours of upper-level (junior or senior) accounting coursework with a GPA of 3.0 or greater.
Program name: Master of Science in Accounting

Requirements: To apply for a graduate program in business, you will need to submit an application through Apply Texas and pay the application fee. You will also need to submit official transcripts from all institutions attended. We do not require letters of recommendation or personal statements. However, you can submit an optional resume with your application. Certain programs also require an entrance exam.
Program name: Master of Science in Finance

Requirements:
Admission to the M.S. in Human Resource Management program is based upon a holistic review of a candidate’s application file. A complete application file consists of the following:

Submit a UHCL application for graduate admission.
Submit official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
Submit an official GMAT (Graduate Management Admission Test) or GRE (Graduate Record Examination) score.
Submit two letters of recommendation.
Submit a current résumé.
Submit a personal essay (one-page minimum) explaining why the applicant is a good candidate for the HRM M.S. program.
Program name: Master of Science in Human Resources Development

Requirements:
In addition to the university's general graduate admission requirements, the College of Human Sciences and Humanities requires the following for the History M.A. program:

*   Statement of Purpose: Applicants must submit a statement of purpose (300-600 words) that describes their academic interests and professional goals. The statement should be uploaded to your UHCL E-Services account.
*   Writing Sample: Applicants must submit a writing sample, approximately 10-15 pages in length and preferably a research paper based on primary sources that was written for an upper-level undergraduate history course. The writing sample should be uploaded to your UHCL E-Services account.
*   Letters of Recommendation: Three letters of recommendation should be sent directly from your recommenders. The letters should ideally be from former professors and should discuss your potential as a graduate student. Your recommenders should email their letters directly to the HSH graduate advising office at HSHAdvising@uhcl.edu.
Program name: Master of Arts in History

Requirements: The graduate applicant must have earned a bachelor's degree in mathematics or a related field. The applicant must have completed Calculus I, Calculus II, Calculus III, and Linear Algebra with a grade of C or better. Additional preferred courses include Differential Equations, Probability, and a programming course. The applicant is expected to have an overall GPA of at least 3.0 in the last 60 hours. A student with an undergraduate degree in a field other than mathematics may be admitted if a review of their application indicates that there is a high probability of their success in the program.
Program name: Master of Science in Mathematics and Statistics

Requirements: Bachelor's degree; 3.0 cumulative GPA on a 4.0 scale; International applicants must also have a TOEFL of 79, IELTS of 6.0, Duolingo of 105 or PTE of 53. Additional Admission Requirements: Resume - a current resume including your employment history, educational history, professional memberships, and community service. Statement of Purpose (500-1,000 words) - Discuss your motivation for pursuing the MHA degree at UHCL, what makes you a good fit for our program, and how the MHA degree will help you achieve your career goals. Address any unique circumstances you would like the Admissions Committee to consider.
Program name: Master of Science in Healthcare Management

Requirements: Graduate Application: Submit an application through the online portal. Application Fee: $50 for domestic students or $125 for international students. Transcripts: Submit official transcripts from every college or university you have attended. Test Scores: Standardized testing is not required. Additional Requirements: Two letters of recommendation; Resume (or CV); Letter of intent (250-500 words); Copy of teacher certification (if pursuing the School Librarian Certification). An interview may be required.
Program name: Master of Science in Information Science

Requirements:
New Student Admission
Graduate School Application: Submit a graduate application online through the UHCL Graduate Application Portal.
Application Fee: $50 ($125 for international applicants).
Official Transcripts: Official transcripts from every college or university attended are required.
GPA: A minimum 2.500 cumulative GPA on a 4.0 scale on the undergraduate degree.
Prerequisite Courses: Applicants must complete the following prerequisite coursework with a grade of "C" or better:
Anatomy and Physiology I and II with labs (8 hours)
General Chemistry I with lab (4 hours)
College Algebra or higher-level math (3 hours)
Statistics (3 hours)
One additional upper-level science course (3-4 hours)
GRE: GRE is not required for admission into this program.
Program name: Master of Science in Exercise Physiology

Requirements: A bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, electrical engineering or computer science, with a 3.0 GPA. Applicants without a bachelor’s degree in a related field but with significant coursework in engineering, science and mathematics can be considered on a case-by-case basis. GRE is not required for applicants with a BS degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or Computer Science from an ABET accredited institution with a GPA of 3.0 or greater. Requirements: To be considered for admission to a UHCL certificate program, you must: 1. Hold a baccalaureate or master's degree from a regionally accredited institution in the U.S. or a recognized international institution. 2. Have a cumulative GPA of at least 2.5 on a 4.0 scale. 3. Meet any additional program-specific requirements. Check the UHCL catalog for your program's admission requirements. How to Apply: 1. Complete the online application through ApplyTexas. 2. Pay the non-refundable application fee. 3. Submit all official transcripts from every college or university you have attended.
Program name: Project Management Certificate

Requirements:

Have a minimum 2.500 cumulative GPA on a 4.000 scale in all prior undergraduate and graduate coursework.
There is no GMAT/GRE requirement for the certificate program.
